page.title: 05Tean High Street(M.Wyatt)
page.content: On my first visit to Tean from Stoke I entered the High Street by crossing the bridge over the River Tean. On my left I saw a row of cottages and a public house, the White Hart, where I had lunch sitting in the beer garden. Opposite is the Recreation Ground near to the River. Past the White Hart is a bicycle shop that sells other items as well. Next is a newsagents where you can buy sweets and stationery. Over the road nearly all the rest of the High Street is taken up by Tean Mill which dominates the street although there is also a butchers,a solicitors and a D.I.Y. shop. Opposite the Mill the road from Cheadle joins the High Street.On either side of the junction is a butchers and a bakers.Several shops are opposite the Mill including a pet food shop and a florists.The Post Office is in the middle of this row.
